title: NASA’s CODEX Captures Unique Views of Sun’s Outer Atmosphere
description: Key Points: Scientists analyzing data from NASA’s CODEX (Coronal Diagnostic Experiment) investigation have successfully evaluated the instrument’s first images, revealing the speed and temperature of material flowing out from the Sun. These images, shared at a press event Tuesday at the American Astronomical Society meeting in Anchorage, Alaska, illustrate the Sun’s outer atmosphere, or corona, […]

title: High Above the World
description: NASA astronaut Franklin Chang-Diaz works with a grapple fixture during a June 2002 spacewalk outside of the International Space Station. He was partnered with CNES (Centre National d’Etudes Spatiales)  astronaut Philippe Perrin for the spacewalk – one of three that occurred during the STS-111 mission. Chang-Diaz was part of NASA’s ninth class of astronaut candidates. […]
author: Monika Luabeya

title: Starlink satellites are leaking radio signals that may ruin astronomy
description: Our ability to study faint radio signals from when the first stars began to form is being threatened by SpaceX's Starlink satellites, which seem to be unintentionally leaking radio signals that overpower astronomers' telescopes

title: Life of first US woman in space Sally Ride makes a moving documentary
description: A new documentary sheds light on the extraordinary story of the US's first woman astronaut, Sally Ride, who defied all expectations in both her career and personal life

title: Jiawen Galaxy Projector Light review
description: It's more of an ambient light projector than a star projector, but the Jiawen Galaxy Projector Light is seriously impressive given its budget price.
author: Kim Snaith

title: Summer Game Fest 2025: The biggest space & sci-fi game reveals and announcements
description: Another summer, another series of hot gaming showcases. These are the space and sci-fi video games that caught our attention during this year's events.
author: Fran Ruiz

title: Astronomers left puzzled by high-altitude clouds forming on young planet
description: Experts say thick slabs of cloud in YSES-1 system could consist of mineral dust and iron, which would rain downShould humans ever venture to a particular planet that circles a sun-like star in the constellation of the fly, they would do well to keep an eye on the weather.The thick slabs of cloud that blot the planet’s skies are mostly made from mineral dust, but astronomers suspect there may be iron in them, too, which would rain down on the world below when the clouds break. Continue reading...
author: Ian Sample Science editor

title: India to send first astronaut on mission to International Space Station
description: Shubhanshu Shukla is part of four-person mission launching on Tuesday from USThe first Indian astronaut to visit the International Space Station is due to blast off as part of an effort by the world’s most populous nation to catch up with the US, Russia and China in human space flight missions.Shubhanshu Shukla, a 39-year-old air force fighter pilot, is is part of four-person mission launching on Tuesday from the US with the private company Axiom Space, which is using a SpaceX capsule. Continue reading...
author: Oliver Holmes
